all_questions.question: What type of machine translation system has been used to translate agreements?
all_questions.context: we've used these superhuman machine translation systems

all_questions.question: How is a sub-lease agreement presented to a tenant in Prague?
all_questions.context: So this is a sub-lease agreement, something that you could easily be signing if you are living in Prague

all_questions.question: What happens when a Czech tenant lives somewhere else and wants to translate an English-subleased agreement into Czech?
all_questions.context: And then if you are Czech living somewhere else, you may get the agreement in English and you want to machine translate it into Czech

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of showing a tenant a double-sided sub-lease agreement?
all_questions.context: One side will be in Czech, you don't understand it at all. The other side will be in English, some vague, some maybe bad English

all_questions.question: Why should the reader not read the sub-lease agreement as a whole?
all_questions.context: Let's not read this as a whole
